definition: to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
to set up camp/Taiwan pr. [an1 ying2 zha2 zhai4]

sentences.english: The construction crew set camp at the specified place.
sentences.chinese: 建筑队在指定地点安营扎寨。

sentences.english: They camped in the woods among the trees.
sentences.chinese: 他们在树林中安营扎寨。

sentences.english: A core group of about two hundred people remain camped throughout the week.
sentences.chinese: 一个有大约200人的核心团体整周保持扎寨。

sentences.english: The soldiers are encamped on the edge of the forest.
sentences.chinese: 战士们在森林边安营扎寨。

sentences.english: The udder cell's genes took up residence in the egg and directed it to grow and develop.
sentences.chinese: 乳腺细胞的基因在该卵子中安营扎寨，令其生长发育。

sentences.english: Queues of buyers who got all-weather pitched a tent here.
sentences.chinese: 排队等候放号的买房者在这里全天候安营扎寨。

sentences.english: They set up camp without saying much, picketed the horses in the meadow.
sentences.chinese: 他们默不做声地安营扎寨，然后把马牵到坡上去吃草。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, anti-dissolution tent camps have sprung up in Kiev.
sentences.chinese: 同时，反对解散令的人们在基辅迅速的安营扎寨。

definition: to set up camp/Taiwan pr. [an1 ying2 zha2 zhai4]
to camp/to pitch camp/stationed/quartered/Taiwan pr. [zha2 ying2]

Yingpan, common place name ("army camp")/place near Jintian village 金田村[Jin1 tian2 cun1] in Guangxi where the Taiping Tianguo rebels took their oaths in 1851/place in Xinfeng county 新豐縣|新丰县[Xin1 feng1 Xian4] traditional camping place of brigands/Yingpan township, place name/Yingpan in Shangluo prefecture, Shaanxi/Yingpan township in Yunnan/(many others)
to rely on natural barriers (for one's defense)
(to resist the enemy) relying on inaccessible territory
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to seize a camp/to surprise the enemy in bed
